study_description: This study applies a modified Detrended Fluctuation Analysis (DFA) to glucose time series for predicting type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). Key aspects include the use of time windows from 15 minutes to 24 hours, which enhanced predictive accuracy, and the analysis of 24-hour segments to minimize circadian rhythm effects. Raw, non-preprocessed data showed greater sensitivity and predictive power compared to preprocessed series. The algorithm also proved robust in handling up to 2% missing data. Principal Component Analysis revealed four components: glucose variability, DFA alpha exponent, and two pre-diabetic behaviors (impaired fasting glucose and impaired glucose tolerance).
